verses.text: 指摘官長與領袖我說：「雅各的首領，你們要聽，以色列家的官長，你們也要聽；難道你們不知道公平嗎？

words.note: Refers to high-ranking officials or leaders.
Refers to high-ranking officials or leaders.

verses.text: 然而，你們恨惡良善，喜愛邪惡，從人身上剝皮，從人骨頭上剔肉。

words.definition: on the body, from the body

verses.text: 你們吃我民的肉，剝他們的皮，打斷他們的骨頭，切成像鍋裡的塊，像釜中的肉塊。

words.note: An ancient cooking vessel, less common in modern usage.

verses.text: 那時，他們要向耶和華呼求，耶和華卻不應允他們。到那時，耶和華必掩面不顧他們，因為他們行了惡事。」

words.note: Figuratively means to ignore or disregard.

verses.text: 責備假先知關於那些使我民走迷路的先知，耶和華這樣說：「他們的牙齒有所咀嚼的時候，就大叫『平安』；誰不把食物給他們吃，他們就攻擊那人。」

words.note: One who knows or speaks beforehand.
One who knows or speaks beforehand.
Forms a nominal phrase with the following verb.
Often used as a greeting or blessing in religious contexts.

verses.text: 因此你們只有黑夜，沒有異象，只有黑暗，沒有默示。對先知，日頭要下落，為他們，白日變為黑暗。

words.note: Refers to supernatural visions, distinct from ordinary sight.
Divine revelation or inspiration.
Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.

verses.text: 先見必抱愧，得默示的人要蒙羞；他們都必掩著上唇，因為沒有 神的答覆。

words.note: Lit. 'one who sees beforehand'.
A classical or formal way to express shame.
Divine revelation or inspiration.
Lit. 'receive shame'. Often used in religious contexts.
The leading space is a traditional mark of respect for divinity.

verses.text: 至於我，我卻藉著耶和華的靈，滿有力量、公平和能力，可以向雅各述說他的過犯，向以色列指出他的罪惡。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God, Yahweh.
Often refers to the Holy Spirit or divine spirit in biblical context.
Often refers to sin or trespass in religious texts.
Can refer to the person, nation, or land.
Stronger than just 'sin', implies deep wickedness.

verses.text: 惡有惡報──聖城被毀雅各家的首領，你們要聽這個，以色列家的官長，你們也要聽；你們厭惡公平，屈枉正直，

words.note: Part of the common idiom '惡有惡報' (evil has evil retribution).
Refers to Jerusalem in biblical context.
Refers to the descendants/nation of Jacob.
Refers to the descendants/nation of Israel.
A high-ranking official or magistrate.
To inflict injustice, to wrongly accuse or punish.

verses.text: 用人血建錫安，以罪孽造耶路撒冷。

words.note: Classical equivalent of '用'.
Stronger term for wickedness, often carrying connotations of deep wrongdoing.

verses.text: 城中的首領為賄賂而審判，祭司為薪俸而教導，先知為銀子說默示，他們竟倚靠耶和華，說：「耶和華不是在我們中間嗎？災禍必不會臨到我們身上。」
所以，為你們的緣故，錫安必像被耕種的田地，耶路撒冷必變為亂堆，這殿的山要成為叢林中的高岡。
